title: What If I address mail to neighbor or current resident, will it be delivered? - Quora

response.answer_text: “What If I address mail to neighbor or current resident, will it be delivered?” Delivered to whom? Mail to “Pat Jones or current resident” will be delivered to the address on the envelope whether Pat Jones lives there or not — even if there has never been a Pat Jones at that address, or if Pat Jones moved months ago. However — people are less inclined to open mail addressed to current resident, as this is the form typically used by bulk mail senders for their advertising. What are you sending? Is it important it get to a house, or to a particular person? Do you need proof it was delivered (or refused)? Would it be simpler to walk over and hand it to Pat Jones yourself?

Put a stamp on it. Put it in a mailbox or take it to the post office. It’s no different than any other mail. I don’t understand why you are asking this question. Mail is mail. The carrier is not going to take a letter with no stamp and deliver it (if that’s what you are asking about).
